activity.bestPlaces: Ram Ki Paidi / Saryu Ghat Riverfront
activity.description: Witness the mesmerizing daily grand evening ritual of lamps and chants dedicated to the Saryu River, often followed by a light and sound show.
essentials: Arrive 30 mins early for a good spot; comfortable seating mat; modest clothing.
activity.fee: Free (The Aarti ceremony itself is free. Donations are voluntary.)

activity.topActivities: Walk Old City Lanes & Hidden Temples
activity.bestPlaces: Inner streets near Hanuman Garhi, Karsevakpuram area
activity.description: Self-explore narrow alleys to find old havelis (mansions), unique murals, small local shrines, and experience the non-touristy life of Ayodhya.
essentials: Comfortable walking shoes; small cash; respect for local privacy; a local map or guide.

activity.description: Hire a local guide to narrate myths, legends, folklore, and historical anecdotes that are not found on standard plaques or in guidebooks.
essentials: Booking confirmation (half-day or full-day); water bottle; good listener's attention.

activity.description: Stroll and relax in the spacious park, and if dates align, attend open-air theatrical performances, katha recitals, or poetry evenings.
essentials: Check local listings for events; blanket/mat for sitting; insect repellent (evening).
activity.fee: Free (unless a ticketed event is running)

activity.bestPlaces: Bahu Begum's Tomb / Moti Mahal (Faizabad area)
activity.description: Visit structures from the Nawabi/Awadh era, offering a contrast to the temple architecture and a glimpse into the Mughal-era history of the region.
essentials: Small entry fee might apply to the Tomb; respectful attire; good transport to Faizabad (if needed).

activity.description: See displays and models representing ancient kitchen tools and culinary traditions, connecting the site's spiritual importance with daily life.
essentials: Respectful conduct inside the temple-museum area.

activity.bestPlaces: Saryu River (via Guptar Ghat or Ram ki Paidi)
activity.description: Take a short boat ride during the "golden hours" for unique architectural photography and a tranquil view of the city reflecting on the water.
essentials: Camera/Sketchbook; bargaining skills for the boat price; life jacket (if provided/necessary).
activity.fee: ₹50 - ₹200 per person (Approx. for a short shared ride)

activity.bestPlaces: Alleyway shops, Chaat Stalls, Temple proximity
activity.description: Go "food trekking" to try local specialties like Ayodhya's famous chaat, peda, rabri, or kachori-sabzi for an authentic taste of the region.
essentials: Small change (Chillar); own water bottle; an adventurous palate; check for hygiene.

activity.description: Climb this small mythological hillock for a panoramic, bird’s-eye view of Ayodhya and the surrounding Saryu river plains.
essentials: Comfortable shoes for the climb; sunscreen/hat.

activity.description: Engage in Seva (selfless service) by helping out in a community kitchen or local temple operations to gain a deeper, participatory insight into local life.
essentials: Modest, clean clothing; willingness to work/help; flexibility in time.
activity.fee: Free (Donations are welcome, but participation is free)
